item.title: 因销售和利润率下降，S&P 将中国万科评级降至 "垃圾 "级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司将中国万科股份有限公司（China Vanke Co.【原文：S&P Global Ratings downgraded China Vanke Co. to junk, underscoring mounting pressure on the state-backed developer as it faces a cash crunch and increased scrutiny from investors.】

item.title: 油价延续涨势，投资者从石油基金撤资 20 亿美元
item.description: 在过去的十个月里，由于原油期货的涨势没有结束的迹象，投资者从这个曾经是最大的石油交易所交易基金中撤资约 20 亿美元。【原文：Investors pulled about $2 billion from what was once the largest oil exchange-traded fund over the last ten months as the rally in crude futures shows no sign of ending.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率再次突破 7%，削弱了购房需求
item.description: 美国上周的抵押贷款利率在一个月内首次突破 7%，而购房申请则出现了自 2 月中旬以来的最大降幅。【原文：US mortgage rates last week topped 7% for the first time in a month, while home purchase applications fell by the most since mid-February.】

item.title: 被禁入的摩根士丹利银行家加入了为他提供交易泄密信息的公司
item.description: 在震惊华尔街的大宗交易调查中受到惩罚的前摩根士丹利银行家加入了其中一家公司，而这家公司正是他泄露机密信息的接收方。【原文：A former Morgan Stanley banker who was punished in the block-trading probe that rattled Wall Street joined one of the firms that was the recipient of confidential information he leaked.】

item.title: 特斯拉销售前景恶化，两位分析师认为 2024 年销量将下降
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Tesla Inc. has spooked Wall Street to where two analysts are now predicting sales will decline this year.】

item.title: 捷克放弃分拆计划，东欧顶级公用事业得到一定缓解
item.description: 捷克立法者废除了一项旨在帮助政府整顿占主导地位的电力公司 CEZ AS 的提案，结束了与投资者长达一年之久的争论，这场争论对该公司的股价造成了影响。【原文：Czech lawmakers scrapped a proposal designed to help the government revamp dominant electricity utility CEZ AS, ending a yearlong tussle with investors that have weighed on the share price.】

item.title: 研究称比亚迪获得 34 亿欧元中国援助以主宰电动汽车市场
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，中国比亚迪股份有限公司至少获得了 34 亿欧元（37 亿美元）的政府直接补贴，这是中国政府推动电动汽车和其他清洁技术发展的一部分。【原文：China’s BYD Co. received at least €3.4 billion ($3.7 billion) in direct government subsidies as part of Beijing’s push to dominate electric vehicles and other clean technologies, according to a new study.】

item.title: 摩根大通、高盛股票交易员为通胀日制定计划
item.description: 华尔街的交易员们正在对市场可能对今天的美国通胀报告做出的反应进行情景分析，他们预测，如果数据出人意料，股市可能会有 2% 的波动。【原文：Wall Street traders are rolling out their scenario analysis for how markets could react to the US inflation report today, predicting stocks could move 2% either way on a surprise number.】

item.title: 可可因全球供应短缺而扩大涨幅，重返历史高位
item.description: 可可在纽约市场上涨，回升至历史新高，人们对全球供应短缺的担忧挥之不去。【原文：Cocoa gained in New York, rising back toward a record high, amid lingering fears about global shortages.】

item.title: 美国考虑禁止向购房者收取贷款人产权保险费
item.description: 美国一家最高级别的消费者监督机构正在考虑是否禁止抵押贷款银行向购房者收取保护贷款人的产权保险费，从而结束该行业长期以来的做法。【原文：A top US consumer watchdog is considering whether to bar mortgage bankers from charging homebuyers for title insurance that protects the lenders, ending a long-standing industry practice.】

item.title: 布里奇沃特的普林斯称降息计划 "偏离轨道
item.description: 桥水联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）联席首席投资官鲍勃-普林斯（Bob Prince）说，美联储的降息计划 "偏离了轨道"。【原文：Bob Prince, the co-chief investment officer of Bridgewater Associates, said the Federal Reserve is “off track” with its plans to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 债券交易员认为市场在通胀来临前倾向于获利
item.description: 由于美国通胀率预计将显示经济中的潜在价格增长正在放缓，国债投资者认为短期内收益空间大于损失。【原文：Treasury investors see more room for gains than losses in the short term as US inflation is expected to show underlying price growth in the economy is slowing.】

item.title: 印度小型股基金两年多来首次出现资金外流
item.description: 在监管机构发出潜在繁荣警告后，印度小型股基金股价暴跌，出现了自 2021 年 9 月以来的首次月度资金外流。【原文：Small-cap funds in India saw the first monthly outflow since September 2021 as shares of such firms plunged following the regulator’s warning of potential exuberance.】

item.title: 波兰公用事业公司大幅下挫，煤炭分拆业务被取消，转而与其他公司合作
item.description: 在一位高级政府官员概述了放弃煤炭资产分拆、转而将煤矿与发电企业重新挂钩的计划之后，波兰电力公司的股价创下了 18 个月以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Shares in Polish power utilities plunged the most in 18 months after a senior government official outlined plans to abandon coal asset spin-offs and instead link mines back with electricity generators.】

item.title: 盈利乐观支撑新兴市场股票在人工智能和中国推动下上涨
item.description: 在人工智能和中国刺激措施的推动下，市场对强劲的财报季持乐观态度，新兴市场股市创下一个月来最长连胜纪录。【原文：Emerging-market stocks headed for the longest winning streak in a month amid optimism for a robust earnings-reporting season driven by artificial intelligence and China’s stimulus measures.】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油再次远高于七国集团的价格上限
item.description: 俄罗斯石油的交易价格远远超出了七国集团的价格上限，而该价格上限本应使莫斯科无法为其在乌克兰的战争获得收入，这表明俄罗斯严重违反了该措施。【原文：Russian oil is trading far in excess of a Group of Seven price cap that’s supposed to deprive Moscow of revenue for its war in Ukraine, suggesting significant non-compliance with the measure.】

item.title: Centrica 交易错误可能导致北欧电力免费供应
item.description: Centrica Plc 北欧分公司的一个交易错误可能导致电价暴跌，以至于该地区的一些家庭周三有时可以免费用电。【原文：A trading error by Centrica Plc’s Nordic arm may have contributed to power prices plunging so low that some homes in the region will get free electricity at times on Wednesday.】

item.title: 环球公司与中国流行音乐组合 TFBoys 签订发行协议
item.description: 环球音乐集团达成一项协议，将在全球发行包括 TFBoys 在内的中国流行音乐。【原文：Universal Music Group NV entered into a deal to distribute the music of Chinese pop acts including TFBoys globally.】

item.title: 全球人工智能服务器需求激增，台湾出口 "火力全开
item.description: 随着支撑全球人工智能热潮的计算机硬件出货量激增 400% 以上，台湾的出口以两年来最快的速度猛增。【原文：Taiwan’s exports surged at the fastest pace in two years as shipments of computer hardware underpinning the global artificial-intelligence boom rocketed more than 400%.】

item.title: 中国嘉实可能在四月晚些时候获得香港现货比特币 ETF 批准
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，中国资产管理公司嘉实基金管理有限公司（Harvest Fund Management Co.【原文：The international arm of Chinese asset manager Harvest Fund Management Co. may get approval from Hong Kong as soon as this month to launch a spot-Bitcoin exchange-traded fund, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行的法律挑战有可能使汽车金融调查复杂化
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局（Financial Conduct Authority）可能不得不延长其对汽车金融行为的长期调查，因为巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）对英国金融投诉消费者监察专员（Ombudsman for Consumer with Financial Complaints）的相关决定提出了法律挑战。【原文：The Financial Conduct Authority may have to extend its long-running probe into motor finance practices after Barclays Plc filed a legal challenge to a decision tied to the matter by the UK’s ombudsman for consumers with financial complaints.】

item.title: 华尔街认为财报推动股市继续反弹
item.description: 利率问题已经过去，是时候让企业盈利来推动股市破纪录的下一轮反弹了。【原文：Move over interest rates, it’s time for corporate earnings to fuel the next leg of the record-breaking stock market rally.】

item.title: 捷克财政部长称 "危机已结束"，前景有所改善
item.description: 捷克政府表示，由于企业投资和家庭支出增加，经济增长前景有所改善，经济有望从大流行病后两年的停滞状态中恢复过来。【原文：The Czech government said the economy was on track to recover from two years of post-pandemic stagnation as the growth outlook improved thanks to stronger corporate investments and household spending.】

item.title: 德国在华企业面临本地竞争对手的 "不公平 "竞争
item.description: 三分之二在华经营的德国企业表示，他们面临着不公平的市场竞争，这一问题可能会推高他们的成本，侵蚀利润空间。【原文：Two-thirds of German companies operating in China say they face unfair competition in the market, a problem that threatens to push up their costs and erode profit margins.】

item.title: 民调显示非国大支持率下降，祖马支持率上升，兰特暴跌
item.description: 一项新的民意调查显示，执政党非洲人国民大会（African National Congress）的支持率急剧下降，前总统雅各布-祖马（Jacob Zuma）支持的一个政党可能成为该国第三大党，兰特从今年的最佳水平下跌。【原文：The rand fell from its best levels this year after a new opinion poll showed support for the ruling African National Congress is plunging and a party backed by former President Jacob Zuma may become the country’s third-biggest.】

item.title: 中国管道巨头开发新的国家天然气价格指数
item.description: 中国的国有管道巨头正在努力创建中国自己的天然气价格指数，因为这个世界上最大的天然气进口国正在寻求对全球成本施加更大的影响。【原文：China’s state-owned pipeline giant is working to create the country’s own natural gas price index as the world’s biggest importer of the fuel seeks more influence on global costs.】

item.title: 经理人调查雪上加霜，中国万科跌至十年新低
item.description: 中国万科集团股份有限公司的股票和债券在下午的交易中扩大跌幅，该开发商称济南市的一位区域经理正在协助调查。【原文：Shares and bonds of China Vanke Co. extended declines in afternoon trading as the developer said a regional manager in the city of Jinan was assisting an investigation.】

item.title: 前外汇局局长称干预是日元过度疲软的一种选择
item.description: 日本前货币局局长表示，干预是解决日元过度疲软的选择之一，他在美国通胀数据公布前发表了这一讲话，美国通胀数据可能会推动日元突破市场参与者密切关注的水平。【原文：Japan’s former currency chief says intervention is among the options to address an excessively weak yen, speaking ahead of US inflation data that may nudge the yen past a level closely watched by market players.】
